caption: The museum is very good; the problem is access: a staircase to climb 2 floors and no elevator! What do disabled people do? Quite scandalous.

Very warm welcome. Small, charming museum. Temporary photography exhibition by Willis Ronis, the banks of the Marne, Menilmontant and Belleville and the permanent exhibition of paintings, very interesting. To have
Nice little museum, with the added bonus of a temporary exhibition by photographer Willy Ronis. A must see

Museum located in a calm and peaceful setting. Good welcome in the museum, clear explanations with the speaker. (Free visit for us today for the free exhibition La Banlieue jardin side) Good time had (even if the size is modest).
Small but very interesting Willy Ronis exhibition
Intercommunal museum which does not have one despite a very good internal team, a very beautiful collection and well-made exhibitions. It deserves to have more resources, space and visibility.

Visit for the first time to the museum with exhibition on the school. Very interesting. We realize the evolution of mentalities and the adaptation of the school to the context of each era. In addition to permanent exhibitions, the museum would benefit from moving towards temporary exhibitions.

Visited for the first time this Sunday. An essential step when you have just moved to Val de Marne and want to discover your new department of residence. A good idea for an outing for a Sunday afternoon. Access is free. We were warmly welcomed and in addition to a smile we gathered a lot of information and anecdotes about the collection: its painters, its cities etc... The place is calm, pleasant & intimate. I thank the person in charge of reception and congratulate her on her work. We had a great time.
Superb experience during Museum Night 2023. Works accessible to all audiences with works by children from local schools, very nice! Museum that is worth the visit.

Museum which presents local history mainly related to the Marne and leisure activities such as taverns or boating. Regularly presents temporary exhibitions, currently on the school until the first semester of 2022. The museum is free.

small, unpretentious but very pleasant museum. Permanent exhibition of interesting paintings which evoke the nautical activities of the banks of the Marne at the time of boaters and guinguettes. and currently a temporary exhibition quite rich in caricatures. what's more, the museum is free and the welcome is warm.
Good welcome and the great paintings of Viaduc
Very well provided walking especially on Saturdays. You can find everything in food, often from Rungis but also from a few 'local' producers. Prices are average to expensive.

Very small museum which nevertheless contains paintings and refreshing objects. The banks of the marl of the last century were very lively and very popular compared to today. The paintings describe well this atmosphere of Sunday and the beauty of the places. The exhibition on the caricatures is quite interesting although small.
Too bad it wasn't guided, a lack of explanation on the Sites.  But I recommend going and seeing.
Old photos and paintings from the banks of the Marne. And the caricature exhibition is very interesting. The guide gave us very very relevant comments MUST SEE
We had a good time
I found the museum to be too small No known painting person to take a tour
Very nice little suburban museum. The life of the time on the banks of the Marne is highlighted there.
A museum that makes do with its means Congratulations to the team for the exhibitions proposed and the themes chosen around the edges of the marne
Impossible to go up to the 2nd floor...not accessible to disabled people. So not visited.
Site not very suitable for a museum, but nice exhibitions.
A beautiful evening "museum night" organized by the museum staff around the painter GUELDRY.
No great experience is very pleasant with all varieties of sculptures ,t
Nice to visit. We see paintings of Nogent and the banks of the Marne. Very welcoming staff.
I didn't find it very good, there are works not looking for. On the other hand, the only strong point is the boat.
Very friendly welcome, our children enjoyed the visit and the questionnaire in the very fun booklet.
Nice little dynamic and well-documented museum
Very nice little museum. Free.
Not bad but small museum
Exciting exhibition ‚ÄúThe caricature tells the story of France‚Äù üòäüëç ‚Ä¶
Beautiful exhibitions with a passionate director
Very warm welcome Interesting exhibitions
Sometimes some nice exhibitions
To have
Small with good presentation
Interesting ! In diversity!
Friendly and free place
